meanings.definition: To treat someone as a celebrity or idol.
meanings.sent1: At the event, the famous singer was lionized by the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The actor was lionized by fans wherever he went.
meanings.sent3: The town lionized the local hero with a grand parade.
meanings.sent4: Her performance on stage lionized her as a star in the making.
meanings.sent5: The media lionized the young athlete's achievements, making her a household name.

meanings.definition: To give someone a lot of attention and admiration.
meanings.sent1: The teacher lionized the student for his exceptional work.
meanings.sent2: The artist was lionized for her unique paintings.
meanings.sent3: The cat lionized its owner with constant purring and affection.
meanings.sent4: The community lionized the firefighter for his bravery in saving lives.
meanings.sent5: The chef was lionized for his culinary skills, attracting food enthusiasts from far and wide.

meanings.definition: To make someone famous or well-known.
meanings.sent1: The viral video lionized the young musician overnight.
meanings.sent2: The book launch event lionized the author in literary circles.
meanings.sent3: The magic show lionized the magician as a master of illusions.
meanings.sent4: The news article lionized the scientist for groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer was lionized after dressing a popular celebrity for an award show.
